<line: 18> Defendant's Attorney
<line: 19> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]
<line: 21>  pleaded guilty to count(s)
<line: 22> 1 of the Indictment, lesser included offense

[TEXT]
<line: 24>  pleaded nolo contendere to count(s)
<line: 25> which was accepted by the court.
<line: 26> was found guilty on count(s)
<line: 27> after a plea of not guilty.

[TEXT]
<line: 29> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[TABLE]
<line: 31> Title & Section
<line: 32> Nature of Offense
<line: 33> Offense Ended
<line: 34> Count
<line: 35> 21 U.S.C.S846SS841
<line: 36> Conspiracy to Possess With Intent to Distribute Cocaine
<line: 37> 9/9/2016
<line: 38> a1andb1C

[TEXT]
<line: 40> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through
<line: 41> 8
<line: 42> of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to
<line: 43> the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 45> The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)

[TEXT]
<line: 47> Count(s)
<line: 48> 2
<line: 49> is
<line: 50>  are dismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 52> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence,
<line: 53> or mailing address until all fines, restitutioncosts,and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid.If ordered to pay restitution,
<line: 54> the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

[TITLE]
<line: 15> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total
<line: 18> term of

[TEXT]
<line: 20> Forty-Eight 48 Months

[TEXT]
<line: 22> The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district

[TEXT]
<line: 28> The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]
<line: 30> before2p.m.on

[TEXT]
<line: 32> as notified by the United States Marshal.

[TEXT]
<line: 34>  as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office

[TITLE]
<line: 36> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 38> I have executed this judgment as follows:

<line: 41> to
<line: 42> with a certified copy of this judgment.

[TITLE]
<line: 14> ADDITIONAL IMPRISONMENT TERMS

[TEXT]
<line: 16> That the defendant be assigned to FCI Lompoc, CA.
<line: 17> That the defendant be placed in the RDAPT Program
<line: 18> That the defendant be given the opportunity to complete his GED

<line: 5> Sheet 3Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Judgment-Page
<line: 8> 4
<line: 9> of

[TEXT]
<line: 11> DEFENDANT:Efrain Gama Hurtado
<line: 12> CASENUMBER:2:16-Cr-190-1

[TITLE]
<line: 14> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 16> Upon release from imprisonment, you will be on supervised release for a term of :
<line: 17> Three (3) Years.

[TITLE]
<line: 19> MANDATORY CONDITIONS

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 1.
<line: 22> You must not commit another federal, state or local crime.
<line: 23> 2.
<line: 24> You must not unlawfully possess a controlled substance.

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 3.
<line: 27> You must refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance.You must submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from

[TEXT]
<line: 29> imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court
<line: 30> The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that you

[TEXT]
<line: 32> pose a low risk of future substance abuse. (check if applicable)
<line: 33> You must cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (check if applicable)

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 4.
<line: 36> 5.
<line: 37>  You must comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.  16901, et seq.) as

[TEXT]
<line: 39> directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons,or any state sex offender registration agency in the location where you
<line: 40> reside, work, are a student, or were convicted of a qualifying offense. (check if applicable
<line: 41> 6.
<line: 42> You must participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (check if applicable)

[TEXT]
<line: 44> You must comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court as well as with any other conditions on the attached
<line: 45> page.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 2:16-cr-00190-JLG Doc #: 79 Filed: 05/15/17 Page: 5 of 8 PAGEID #: 730

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> AO245BRev.11/16
<line: 5> Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 6> Shect 3A-Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 8> Judgment-Page
<line: 9> 5
<line: 10> of
<line: 11> 8

[TEXT]
<line: 13> DEFENDANT: Efrain Gama Hurtado
<line: 14> CASENUMBER:2:16-cr-190-1

[TITLE]
<line: 16> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 18> As part of your supervised release, you must comply with the following standard conditions of supervision. These conditions are imposed
<line: 19> because they establish the basic expectations for your behavior while on supervision and identify the minimum tools needed by probation
<line: 20> officers to keep informed, report to the court about, and bring about improvements in your conduct and condition.

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 1.
<line: 23> You must report to the probation office in the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside within 72 hours of your
<line: 24> release from imprisonment, unless the probation officer instructs you to report to a different probation office or within a different time
<line: 25> frame.
<line: 26> 2.
<line: 27> After initially reporting to the probation office, you will receive instructions from the court or the probation officer about how and
<line: 28> when you must report to the probation officer, and you must report to the probation officer as instructed.
<line: 29> 3.
<line: 30> You must not knowingly leave the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside without first getting permission from the
<line: 31> court or the probation officer.
<line: 32> 4.
<line: 33> You must answer truthfully the questions asked by your probation officer.
<line: 34> 5.
<line: 35> You must live at a place approved by the probation officer. If you plan to change where you live or anything about your living
<line: 36> arrangements (such as the people you live with), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying
<line: 37> the probation officer in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72
<line: 38> hours of becoming aware of a change or expected change.
<line: 39> 6.
<line: 40> You must allow the probation officer to visit you at any time at your home or elsewhere, and you must permit the probation officer to.
<line: 41> take any items prohibited by the conditions of your supervision that he or she observes in plain view.
<line: 42> 7.
<line: 43> You must work full time (at least 30 hours per week) at a lawful type of employment, unless the probation officer excuses you from
<line: 44> doing so.If you do not have full-time employment you must try to find full-time employment unless the probation officer excuses
<line: 45> you from doing so. If you plan to change where you work or anything about your work such as your position or your job
<line: 46> responsibilities), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change.If notifying the probation officer at least 10
<line: 47> days in advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours of
<line: 48> becoming aware of a change or expected change.
<line: 49> 8.
<line: 50> You must not communicate or interact with someone you know is engaged in criminal activity. If you know someone has been
<line: 51> convicted of a felony, you must not knowingly communicate or interact with that person without first getting the permission of the
<line: 52> probation officer
<line: 53> 9.
<line: 54> If you are arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours.
<line: 55> 10.
<line: 56> You must not own possess, or have access to a firearm ammunition,destructive device, or dangerous weapon (i.e. anything that was
<line: 57> designed, or was modified for, the specific purpose of causing bodily injury or death to another person such as nunchakus or tasers).
<line: 58> 11.
<line: 59> You must not act or make any agreement with a law enforcement agency to act as a confidential human source or informant without.
<line: 60> first getting the permission of the court.
<line: 61> 12.
<line: 62> If the probation officer determines that you pose a risk to another person (including an organization), the probation officer may
<line: 63> require you to notify the person about the risk and you must comply with that instruction.The probation officer may contact the
<line: 64> person and confirm that you have notified the person about the risk.
<line: 65> 13.
<line: 66> You must follow the instructions of the probation officer related to the conditions of supervision.

[TITLE]
<line: 68> U.S. Probation Office Use Only

[TEXT]
<line: 70> A U.S.probation officer has instructed me on the conditions specified by the court and has provided me with a written copy of this
<line: 71> judgment containing these conditions.For further information regarding these conditions, see Overview of Probation and Supervised
<line: 72> Release Conditions, available at: www.uscourts.gov.

[ABANDON]
<line: 74> Defendant's Signature

[ABANDON]
<line: 76> Date

[TITLE]
<line: 13> ADDITIONAL SUPERVISED RELEASE TERMS

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 1) The defendant shall work to obtain his general equivalency diploma.

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 2) The defendant shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for alcohol and controlled substance abuse, as
<line: 18> directed by the U.S.Probation Office, until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the probation office.
<line: 19> The co-payment is waived for these services

[TITLE]
<line: 15> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant must pay the total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on Sheet 6.

[ISOLATE_FORMULA]
<line: 19> Assessment
<line: 20> JVTA Assessment*
<line: 21> Fine
<line: 22> Restitution
<line: 23> TOTALS
<line: 24> $100.00
<line: 25> $
<line: 26> $

[TEXT]
<line: 28> The determination of restitution is deferred until
<line: 29> .An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (A0 245C) will be entered
<line: 30> after such determination.

[TEXT]
<line: 32> The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> If the defendant makes a partial payment,each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in
<line: 35> the priority order or percentage payment column below.However, pursuant to 18U.s.C.s 3664(i),all nonfederal victims must be paid
<line: 36> before the United States is paid.

[TITLE]
<line: 38> Name of Payee
<line: 39> Total Loss**
<line: 40> Restitution Ordered
<line: 41> Priority or Percentage

[TEXT]
<line: 43> TOTALS

[TEXT]
<line: 45> Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement$

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 48> The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before the
<line: 49> fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 3612(f).All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be subject
<line: 50> to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(g).

[TEXT]
<line: 52> The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:

[TEXT]
<line: 54> the interest requirement is waived for the
<line: 55> fine
<line: 56> restitution.
<line: 57> the interest requirement for the
<line: 58> fine
<line: 59> restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 61> * Justice for Victims of Trafficking Act of 2015Pub.L.No.114-22.
<line: 62> required under Chapters 109A,110,110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or
<line: 63> after September 13,1994,but before April 23,1996.

[TITLE]
<line: 17> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 19> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties is due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 21> A
<line: 22> Lump sum payment of$
<line: 23> 100.00
<line: 24> due immediately, balance due
<line: 25> not later than
<line: 26> ,or
<line: 27> in accordance with C,
<line: 28>  D,
<line: 29> E,or
<line: 30>  F below; or
<line: 31> B
<line: 32> Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 33> C,
<line: 34> D,or
<line: 35> F below);or
<line: 36> C
<line: 37> Payment in equal
<line: 38> e.g.weekly monthly,quarterly) installments of S
<line: 39> over a period of
<line: 40> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 41> e.g., 30 or 60 days after the date of this judgment or
<line: 42> D
<line: 43> Payment in equal
<line: 44> (e.g. weekly, monthly,quarterly) installments of $
<line: 45> over a period of
<line: 46> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 47> (e.g.,30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 48> term of supervision;or
<line: 49> E
<line: 50> Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within
<line: 51> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from
<line: 52> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time; or
<line: 53> F
<line: 54> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:

[TEXT]
<line: 56>  While incarcerated, if the defendant is working in a non-UNICOR or grade 5 UNICOR job, the defendant shall pay
<line: 57> $25 per quarter toward his restitution obligation. If working in a grade 1-4 UNIcOR job,he shall pay 50% of his
<line: 58> monthly pay toward the restitution obligation. Any change in this schedule shall be made only by order of this
<line: 59> Court.

[TEXT]
<line: 61> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, ifthis judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due during
<line: 62> Financial Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 64> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[TEXT]
<line: 66>  Joint and Several

[TEXT]
<line: 68> Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,
<line: 69> and corresponding payee, if appropriate.

[TEXT]
<line: 71> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution.
<line: 72> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s)
<line: 73> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:

[TEXT]
<line: 75> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2 restitution principal,(3) restitution interest, (4 fine principal, (5) fine
<line: 76> interest, (6) community restitution, (7) JVTA assessment, (8) penalties, and (9) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
